Dear Sharon Renee Berkobien:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 3 allegedly strangled Youth A. There are no reported injuries
nor visible injuries.
Investigation On 8/26/24 I left a voicemail for Complainant. A return call was
received, and no new information was provided.
On 8/26/24, I spoke to Adoption Worker. Adoption Worker
reported she saw Youth A on 8/24/24 and did not see any marks
or bruises on Youth A.
On 8/26/24, I spoke to Administrator. No new information was
provided.
The alleged incident occurred on 8/24/24. All interviews were
conducted face to face at the facility unless otherwise noted.
Staff 1 reported he was in his office when he heard Youth A
screaming in the lobby area. Staff 1 reported when he entered the
lobby area, Staff 2 and Staff 3 had their hands on Youth A’s arms
and shoulders attempting to have him sit down. Staff 1 asked
them to let Youth A go, and they did. Staff 1 was hoping to be able
to deescalate Youth A verbally because he felt he had a good
relationship with Youth A. Once they let Youth A go, Youth A
punched Staff 2. Staff 1 reported he got in between Youth A and
Staff 2. Staff 1 told Staff 2 to leave the area so Youth A would not
attempt to attack him again. Staff 3 then grabbed Youth A by the
collar of his shirt and pushed Youth A into a nearby chair. (This
chair had wheels on it). Staff 1 reported Staff 3 was yelling at
Youth A. Staff 1 was unable to remember what was yelled. Staff 1
asked Staff 3 to let go and he did. Staff 3 then left the room. Youth
A was no longer escalated at this point. Staff 1 reported Youth A
did have red marks on his neck area due to the collar of his shirt
rubbing against him. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 did not choke Youth A
but did grab his shirt.
Staff 2 reported he was in the lobby area with Youth A and Staff
3. Youth A was escalated and kicking doors and walls. Youth A
kicked him in the private area and then went to pull the fire alarm.
Staff 2 reported he stopped Youth A by wrapping his arms around
him and moving him from the alarm. While moving him, they lost
their balance and began to fall. Staff 2 reported he did not fall the
2

entire way but did have Youth A still in his grasp. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 entered the lobby and told him to let Youth A go. Once he
let him go, Staff 2 reported Youth A began punching him in the
face and head. Staff 2 reported “they” pulled Youth A off of him
and he did see Staff 3 grab Youth A by the shirt to remove him.
When Staff 3 moved him, he turned him and placed him in the
chair. Staff 3 did not state that he pushed him into the chair, only
that he placed him in the chair. Staff 2 reported he did not see
Staff 3 choke Youth A. Staff 2 reported he did not hear any staff
threaten Youth A during this time. Staff 2 reported he did not see
any marks on Youth A nor did Youth A verbalize he was hurt.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 9/10/24. Staff 3 reported
Youth A was kicking on doors because he was told “no”. Youth A
attempted to get into the chapel area and Staff 3 verbally
redirected him and Youth A then attempted to punch him in the
face. Staff 3 reported he blocked the punch. Staff 3 reported Staff
2 was present. Staff 3 reported Youth A went to pull the fire alarm
and Staff 2 followed him, verbally redirected him and then grabbed
his arms from behind. Staff 3 reported he attempted to come over
and help Staff 2, but Youth A was punching and kicking. Staff 1
then came into the area and told Staff 2 to release Youth A. When
he did, Youth A started to punch Staff 2 four to five times. Staff 3
reported he then went to grab Youth A’s arm but grabbed the
collar of his hoodie instead, this turned Youth A around and Youth
A kicked him in the groin area. Because he had him by the
sweatshirt, he pushed Youth A forward and Youth A went into the
nearby chair. Staff 3 reported he had both hands on his
sweatshirt, holding on to him so they both didn’t fall to the floor.
Youth A then punched Staff 3 in the face and knocked his glasses
off. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 told him to let him go and he did. Staff
3 reported he never choked Youth A but did accidently grab his
sweatshirt collar.
Youth A reported he was placed in an “illegal restraint.” Youth A
reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 were twisting his arm and hitting him.
Youth A reported he could not remember what was going on
before this happened. Youth A reported Staff 2 and Staff 3
attempted to restrain him and then ended up placing him in a
chair. Youth A did not report he was forced in the chair only that
their attempted restraint wound up placing him in a chair. Youth A
reported he was choked by Staff 3. Youth A reported Staff 3’s
hand was wrapped around his neck. Youth A reported Staff 1
came in and told Staff 3 to leave and he did. Youth A reported he
had marks near his neck.
3

Video Reviewed:
I watched the video dated 8/24/24 from 6:06pm-6:10pm. Youth A
was visibly upset. He was kicking doors and walls. This went on
until 6:08pm where Youth A attempted to pull the fire alarm. Staff
2 placed his hand over the fire alarm and was bit by Youth A. Staff
2 then bear hugged Youth A and pulled him away from the fire
alarm. Staff 3 then engaged and attempted to grab Youth A’s arm.
Youth A was struggling during this. Staff 2 was heard saying, “Are
you going to hit me again?” Staff 3 was no longer holding Youth A.
Both Staff 2 and Youth A began to go towards the ground. Staff 1
goes down to one knee, but still has Youth A’s arm. Staff 1
entered the area and said, “release him.” Staff 2 released him and
Youth A then punched Staff 2 in the face and head area. Staff 3
then grabbed Youth A by the back of the shirt (upper arm/shoulder
area) and moved him appropriately into the chair. Youth A
punched Staff 3 in the face and his glasses fall off. Staff 3 is still
holding onto Youth A’s left arm and right shoulder and bunches up
the sweatshirt. Staff 3 pushed the chair. Staff 1 told Staff 3 to
disengage and Staff 3 did not listen. Staff 3 then yelled at Youth A,
“Try it again!” Staff 1 removed Staff 3’s hands from Youth A’s shirt
and then Staff 3 left.
Documents Reviewed:
• Medical documents were not completed after this restraint.
Staff had assessed there were no injuries via incident
report.
• Personnel files for Staff 2 and Staff 3. Both were up to date
with training. Neither had disciplinary action in their files.
• Incident Report dated 8/24/24 was consistent with both
Staff 2 and Staff 3 interviews. The video did not clearly
show Staff 3 being hit in the groin area, but this was
recorded on the incident report.
• I reviewed the behavior management policy which is
consistent with the rules and prohibits any type of physical
punishment.
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule, but not due to the
allegations of Staff 3 choking Youth A. Video observation and
interviews do not show Youth A being choked by any staff. Staff 3,
after being kicked in the groin area, grabbed and bunched up
Youth A’s sweatshirt and pushed the chair, yelling at Youth A.
Staff 1 had to remove Staff 3’s hands from Youth A. Although Staff
3 was kicked in the groin, he should have released Youth A,
instead of pushing and increasing his grip on him.
4

Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
